RDO with dependencies

Source: vignettes/a02-rdo-with-dependencies.Rmd
a02-rdo-with-dependencies.Rmd

Creating an RDO with dependencies

Let’s start by creading a simple RDO that will be a dependency for another RDO.

data_mtcars <- RDO::RDO$new(name = "data_mtcars")

data_mtcars$code <- expression({
  data_mtcars <- mtcars
})

Now let’s create a new RDO with R code that needs the data_mtcars object to be evaluated first.

mtcars_half_top <- RDO::RDO$new(name = "mtcars_half_top")

mtcars_half_top$code <- expression({
  mtcars_half_top <- head(data_mtcars, 16)
})

The code needs data_mtcars as dependency but no dependency is defined yet.

mtcars_half_top$has_dependencies()
#> [1] FALSE

Running the RDO code will give an error as the dependecy is missing.

mtcars_half_top$run()
#> Evaluating RDO: mtcars_half_top ...
#> Error while running RDO code! 
#> Always check for missing dependencies...
#> Error in x[seq_len(n)]: object of type 'environment' is not subsettable

We can add add the missing dependency to the RDO.

mtcars_half_top$add_dependencies(dependencies = data_mtcars)

mtcars_half_top$run()
#> Evaluating RDO: mtcars_half_top ... has dependencies ...
#> RDO: 'data_mtcars' is NOT VALIDATED!
#> Error in .f(.x[[i]], ...): Dependency object 'data_mtcars' is not validated.

Running the code still gives an error. This time the dependency is present but is not validated. Let’s run the dependency code first.

data_mtcars$run()
#> Evaluating RDO: data_mtcars ... done!
#> ...evaluation of data_mtcars completed.
mtcars_half_top$run()
#> Evaluating RDO: mtcars_half_top ... has dependencies ...
#> RDO: 'data_mtcars' is validated.
#> ...evaluation of mtcars_half_top completed.
NROW(mtcars_half_top$cache)
#> [1] 16
mtcars_half_top$code
#> <RDO code>
#> mtcars_half_top <- head(data_mtcars, 16)
#> <RDO>
#> Name: mtcars_half_top 
#> Dependencies: 
#> - data_mtcars
#> Status:
#> - created:        2020-03-02 12:52:01 UTC 
#> - last changed:   2020-03-02 12:52:02 UTC 
#> - last touched:   2020-03-02 12:52:02 UTC 
#> - last validated: 2020-03-02 12:52:02 UTC 
#> - last run time:  0.0160009860992432 
#> - run time total: 0.0160009860992432 
#> - is validated?   TRUE 
#> - is locked?      FALSE 
#> - cache size:     0.0044 Mb 
#> - cached total:   0.0113 Mb

We can see that our mtcars_half_top RDO has data_mtcars RDO as dependency. The object is valdiated, and the cache contains top 16 rows of mtcars dataset.

Example RDO definitions

Let’s define more RDOs with respective R code. We can use dependencies argument of the constructor function to set dependencies in one step.

mtcars_half_bottom <-
  RDO::RDO$new(name = "mtcars_half_bottom",
               dependencies = list(data_mtcars))

mtcars_half_bottom$code <- expression({
  mtcars_half_bottom <- tail(data_mtcars, 16)
})

mtcars_whole <-
  RDO::RDO$new(name = "mtcars_whole",
               dependencies = list(mtcars_half_top,
                                   mtcars_half_bottom))

mtcars_whole$code <- expression({
  mtcars_whole <- rbind(mtcars_half_top,
                        mtcars_half_bottom)
})

data_iris <-
  RDO::RDO$new(name = "data_iris")

data_iris$code <- expression({
  data_iris <- iris
})

iris_selected_rows <-
  RDO::RDO$new(name = "iris_selected_rows",
               dependencies = list(data_iris))

iris_selected_rows$code <- expression({
  set.seed(1234)
  sampled_rows <- c(rep(TRUE, 32), rep(FALSE, NROW(data_iris) - 32))
  iris_selected_rows <- data_iris[sample(sampled_rows, NROW(data_iris)), ]
})

iris_selected_columns <-
  RDO::RDO$new(name = "iris_selected_columns",
               dependencies = list(iris_selected_rows))

iris_selected_columns$code <- expression({
  iris_selected_columns <- iris_selected_rows[, c("Species", "Petal.Width")]
})

iris_mtcars <-
  RDO::RDO$new(name = "iris_mtcars",
               dependencies = list(mtcars_whole,
                                   iris_selected_columns))

iris_mtcars$code <- expression({
  iris_mtcars <- cbind(iris_selected_columns, mtcars_whole)
})

iris_mtcars_test <-
  RDO::RDO$new(name = "iris_mtcars_test",
               dependencies = list(iris_mtcars))

iris_mtcars_test$code <- expression({

  stopifnot("mpg" %in% names(iris_mtcars))
  iris_mtcars <- iris_mtcars

})

Deep dependencies

Most RDO methods has deep parameter. W hen set to FALSE (default) you won’t be interacting with RDO dependencies. If set to TRUE the method will touch all deep dependencies inside your RDO. By deep dependencies I mean all dependencies of the RDO, their dependencies, and dependencies of their dependencies, etc.

Let’s take the iris_mtcars_test RDO that is at the top of our RDO tree, and see the code needed to reproduce the whole tree.

iris_mtcars_test$print_code(deep = TRUE)
#> data_mtcars <- mtcars
#> mtcars_half_top <- head(data_mtcars, 16)
#> mtcars_half_bottom <- tail(data_mtcars, 16)
#> data_iris <- iris
#> set.seed(1234)
#> sampled_rows <- c(rep(TRUE, 32), rep(FALSE, NROW(data_iris) - 32))
#> iris_selected_rows <- data_iris[sample(sampled_rows, NROW(data_iris)), ]
#> mtcars_whole <- rbind(mtcars_half_top, mtcars_half_bottom)
#> iris_selected_columns <- iris_selected_rows[, c("Species", "Petal.Width")]
#> iris_mtcars <- cbind(iris_selected_columns, mtcars_whole)
#> stopifnot("mpg" %in% names(iris_mtcars))
#> iris_mtcars <- iris_mtcars

We can check what dependencies are validated.

iris_mtcars_test$is_validated(deep = TRUE)
#> RDO: 'data_mtcars' is validated.
#> RDO: 'mtcars_half_top' is validated.
#> RDO: 'mtcars_half_bottom' is NOT VALIDATED!
#> RDO: 'data_iris' is NOT VALIDATED!
#> RDO: 'iris_selected_rows' is NOT VALIDATED!
#> RDO: 'mtcars_whole' is NOT VALIDATED!
#> RDO: 'iris_selected_columns' is NOT VALIDATED!
#> RDO: 'iris_mtcars' is NOT VALIDATED!
#> RDO: 'iris_mtcars_test' is NOT VALIDATED!
#> [1] FALSE

Let’s run the code with deep = TRUE. It will run the code of all not validated RDOs.

iris_mtcars_test$run(deep = TRUE)
#> Evaluating RDO: iris_mtcars_test ... has dependencies ...
#> RDO: 'data_mtcars' is validated.
#> RDO: 'mtcars_half_top' is validated.
#> RDO: 'mtcars_half_bottom' is NOT VALIDATED!
#> Evaluating RDO: mtcars_half_bottom ... has dependencies ...
#> RDO: 'data_mtcars' is validated.
#> ...evaluation of mtcars_half_bottom completed.
#> RDO: 'data_iris' is NOT VALIDATED!
#> Evaluating RDO: data_iris ... done!
#> ...evaluation of data_iris completed.
#> RDO: 'iris_selected_rows' is NOT VALIDATED!
#> Evaluating RDO: iris_selected_rows ... has dependencies ...
#> RDO: 'data_iris' is validated.
#> ...evaluation of iris_selected_rows completed.
#> RDO: 'mtcars_whole' is NOT VALIDATED!
#> Evaluating RDO: mtcars_whole ... has dependencies ...
#> RDO: 'mtcars_half_top' is validated.
#> RDO: 'mtcars_half_bottom' is validated.
#> ...evaluation of mtcars_whole completed.
#> RDO: 'iris_selected_columns' is NOT VALIDATED!
#> Evaluating RDO: iris_selected_columns ... has dependencies ...
#> RDO: 'iris_selected_rows' is validated.
#> ...evaluation of iris_selected_columns completed.
#> RDO: 'iris_mtcars' is NOT VALIDATED!
#> Evaluating RDO: iris_mtcars ... has dependencies ...
#> RDO: 'mtcars_whole' is validated.
#> RDO: 'iris_selected_columns' is validated.
#> ...evaluation of iris_mtcars completed.
#> RDO: 'iris_mtcars' is validated.
#> ...evaluation of iris_mtcars_test completed.
iris_mtcars_test$is_validated(deep = TRUE)
#> RDO: 'data_mtcars' is validated.
#> RDO: 'mtcars_half_top' is validated.
#> RDO: 'mtcars_half_bottom' is validated.
#> RDO: 'data_iris' is validated.
#> RDO: 'iris_selected_rows' is validated.
#> RDO: 'mtcars_whole' is validated.
#> RDO: 'iris_selected_columns' is validated.
#> RDO: 'iris_mtcars' is validated.
#> RDO: 'iris_mtcars_test' is validated.
#> [1] TRUE

Now the iris_mtcars_test RDO is deeply validated as all its dependencies are validated as well.

Accessing dependencies

We can access any RDO dependency with get_dependencies() method. With deep = TRUE the method returns a list of all deep unique dependencies. Each RDO on this dependency list can be accessed directly.

names(iris_mtcars_test$get_dependencies(deep = TRUE))
#> [1] "data_mtcars"           "mtcars_half_top"       "mtcars_half_bottom"   
#> [4] "data_iris"             "iris_selected_rows"    "mtcars_whole"         
#> [7] "iris_selected_columns" "iris_mtcars"

iris_mtcars_test$get_dependencies(deep = TRUE)$data_mtcars$code
#> <RDO code>
#> data_mtcars <- mtcars
#> <RDO>
#> Name: data_mtcars 
#> Dependencies: none.
#> Status:
#> - created:        2020-03-02 12:52:01 UTC 
#> - last changed:   2020-03-02 12:52:02 UTC 
#> - last touched:   2020-03-02 12:52:02 UTC 
#> - last validated: 2020-03-02 12:52:02 UTC 
#> - last run time:  0 
#> - run time total: 0 
#> - is validated?   TRUE 
#> - is locked?      FALSE 
#> - cache size:     0.0069 Mb 
#> - cached total:   0.0069 Mb

Prunning cache

If we don’t need to keep the data cache in all dependencies we can remove it using prune_cache() method. The cache won’t be removed from locked RDOs.

Let’s lock some RDOs and clear cache in the rest.

as.numeric(iris_mtcars_test$get_status()$cache_size_total)
#> [1] 48256
data_mtcars$lock()$is_locked()
#> Locking RDO: 'data_mtcars' ... done.
#> RDO: 'data_mtcars' is LOCKED!
#> [1] TRUE
data_iris$lock()$is_locked()
#> Locking RDO: 'data_iris' ... done.
#> RDO: 'data_iris' is LOCKED!
#> [1] TRUE
iris_mtcars_test$prune_cache(deep = TRUE)
#> RDO: 'data_mtcars' is locked!
#> Cache in RDO: 'mtcars_half_top' was cleared.
#> Cache in RDO: 'mtcars_half_bottom' was cleared.
#> RDO: 'data_iris' is locked!
#> Cache in RDO: 'iris_selected_rows' was cleared.
#> Cache in RDO: 'mtcars_whole' was cleared.
#> Cache in RDO: 'iris_selected_columns' was cleared.
#> Cache in RDO: 'iris_mtcars' was cleared.
as.numeric(iris_mtcars_test$get_status()$cache_size_total)
#> [1] 20608

The cache from unlocked RDOs was removed and we reduced the total cache size.

Ploting an RDO tree

We can plot the whole RDO tree. The blue RDOs are validated, the orange ones are not. You can zoom in or out the interactive plot and see the details of each RDO.

iris_mtcars_test$plot_dependencies()
